results.title: Seven (Special edition) [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Arnold Kopelson, Phyllis Carlyle and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A serial killer is murdering people according to a deranged righteous rationale, punishing people for their indulgence in the seven deadly sins. Morgan Freeman is Detective Somerset, a police officer who has seen too much crime and has witnessed for too long the savagery of a decaying urban world. Brad Pitt is young Detective Mills, eager to prove his abilities and excited to have landed a fascinating if gruesome case. “Seven” is a film that betrays an almost misanthropic contempt for the contemporary world; a world in which spirituality is infused with vengeance and where relationships are tainted by exploitation. The nameless city is always dark and wet, and begins to resemble a vision of Hell. “Seven” includes stunning photography, electrifying editing and a meticulous soundtrack. The film confronts the viewer with the hateful extremities of evil. It remains unforgettable because it also suggests that evil is not the prerogative of monsters.

results.title: Seven (Collector's Edition) [Widescreen] (D)
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Arnold Kopelson, Phyllis Carlyle and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A serial killer is murdering people according to a deranged righteous rationale, punishing people for their indulgence in the seven deadly sins. Morgan Freeman is Detective Somerset, a police officer who has seen too much crime and has witnessed for too long the savagery of a decaying urban world. Brad Pitt is young Detective Mills, eager to prove his abilities and excited to have landed a fascinating if gruesome case. ‘Seven’ is a film that betrays an almost misanthropic contempt for the contemporary world; a world in which spirituality is infused with vengeance and where relationships are tainted by exploitation. The nameless city is always dark and wet, and begins to resemble a vision of Hell. ‘Seven’ includes stunning photography, electrifying editing and a meticulous soundtrack. The film confronts the viewer with the hateful extremities of evil. It remains unforgettable because it also suggests that evil is not the prerogative of monsters. Cast includes Gwyneth Paltrow and a diabolically good Kevin Spacey. Do not miss the opening credit sequence.

results.title: With inertia
results.brief_description: A stylish exploration of life, death, friendship, drugs, work and unemployment. Five girls living in the city and on the edge, their fast and not so fast lives.

results.title: With Burning Patience
results.creator_credit: Antonio Skarmeta, Prole Film, Von Vietinghoff Filmproduktion and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: A film of impassioned charm tracing the lives of little people caught up in large events. A haunting poetic drama which blends Chilean history at the time of the downfall of the Allende government in 1973, with a delicate village love story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonio Skarmeta, Prole Film, Von Vietinghoff Filmproduktion and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen

results.title: Witch hunt
results.brief_description: Presented by George Donikan, this documentary is a “Four Corners” style investigation into the so-called Greek Social Security Conspiracy Fraud. The whole story of the scandal and the role of the Federal Police and the Department of Social Security is explored in this documentary.

results.title: Two years or more
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Gilles Therien, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An inside look at a modern federal penal institution of the kind built during the past decade, showing improvements that have been made not only in the physical facilities for housing inmates but also in the treatment and training programs. Emphasis is now placed on rehabilitation of the individual rather than on punishment for his crime.

results.title: Western stories: expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description:
Western Stories : Expressions for the Future is an inspirational collection of works from young people who, through their association with the Western Chances program, have been given the opportunity to tell their stories and build their own bridge to the future.
Western Chances was established to ensure that financial hardship does not prevent a young person in Melbourne’s West from achieving their maximum potential in life.

results.title: Two songs by Dougie Young. Dread beat and blood
results.creator_credit: Michael Buckley, John Bird, Franco Rosso, Arts Council of Great Britain and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Two Songs by Dougie Young (Melb., 1979, 7 min.): Aboriginal singer Dougie Young sings two of his songs as the basis of an animated film about aboriginal issues. “Dread Beat and Blood” (U.K., 1979, 47 min.): A unique combination of poetry, music and politics is portrayed in this film about black reggae musician Lindsay Kwesi Johnson.

results.title: What Happened to Kerouac?
results.brief_description: This film is a fascinating portrait of Jack Kerouac, the author of “On the road” and reluctant King of the Beat Generation. Includes interviews with family members and cronies including Allen Ginsberg, William Burroughs and Edie Kerouac Parker. This film is a candid and moving biography of one of America’s most influential authors. It is a terrifying and exhilarating film about a troubled genius whose influence is still being felt all over the world.

results.title: Two thirds sky
results.creator_credit: Sean O'Brien, Sophie Jackson, Arcadia Pictures and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: This visually stunning documentary is an innovative portrait of the Australian desert as seen through the eyes of five contemporary Australian artists: Gloria Petyarre, Judy Watson, Peter Sharp, Jenny Sages and Idris Murphy. Following the creative journeys of the artists - both Indigenous and non-Indigenous - from blank canvas to finished painting, the film provides a fresh insight into the connections between art and place and our changing attitudes to Australia’s outback. Each artist has a different relationship to the land they paint yet all are attempting to express their identity and sense of belonging through their work. Beautiful visual imagery edited in a series of striking dissolves and fades, clearly demonstrates the relationships between the artists’ work and the land. Cinematography by Joel Peterson. Editing by Nick Meyers. Comprehensive teachers notes available at: http://www.filmaust.com.au/programs/teachers_notes/8607twothirdssky.pdf
